title: Dompet with Beaded Butterfly and Flower Design Beaded purse with butterfly and flower design

  object_work_type: purses (ladies\u0027 accessories)

  title_text: Dompet with Beaded Butterfly and Flower Design Beaded purse with butterfly and flower design

  preference: main alternate

  title_language:

  inscriptions:

  shape: semicircular

  materials_name: glass (material) sequins (sprangles) velvet (fabric weave) metal

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a beaded purse in a semicircular shape. Made from red velvet
 the face of the purse is decorated with embroided beads and stitching. There is a bead button in the center
 holding the flap closed. The purse is decorated with floral motifs along the border. In the center
 there is a beaded butterfly
 with a flower stalk on either side.

  subject_terms_1: pouches beadwork (visual works) Peranakan flower (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Pouches (Containers) Peranakan (Asian people) Beadwork

  subject_terms_3: Decorative arts

  sgcool_label_text: This dompet has a unique semi-circular shape quite unlike other envelope purses. Chain and bullion stiches are used to create the contours of a butterfly and two stalks of flowers. Unlike Chinese purses which were either square or circular in shape
 the purses made for or by the Peranakan community show more variation.

metadata.title_text: Dompet with Beaded Butterfly and Flower Design Beaded purse with butterfly and flower design
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a beaded purse in a semicircular shape. Made from red velvet, the face of the purse is decorated with embroided beads and stitching. There is a bead button in the center, holding the flap closed. The purse is decorated with floral motifs along the border. In the center, there is a beaded butterfly, with a flower stalk on either side.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This dompet has a unique semi-circular shape quite unlike other envelope purses. Chain and bullion stiches are used to create the contours of a butterfly and two stalks of flowers. Unlike Chinese purses which were either square or circular in shape, the purses made for or by the Peranakan community show more variation.
